meanings.definition: More somber or gloomy in appearance or character.
meanings.sent1: The sky grew somberer as the storm approached.
meanings.sent2: Her somberer expression indicated she was not in the mood to talk.
meanings.sent3: The somberer clouds seemed to be frowning down at the picnic.
meanings.sent4: His somberer demeanor cast a shadow over the cheerful gathering.
meanings.sent5: The somberer music played in the background, setting a melancholic tone.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is more somber or gloomy than another.
meanings.sent1: She was the somberer of the two sisters, always dressed in dark colors.
meanings.sent2: The old mansion looked like a somberer version of its former self.
meanings.sent3: The somberer of the two cats refused to play with the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The somberer of the paintings in the gallery caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The somberer of the two statues seemed to be silently mourning its companion.
